conclusion: Objects A and B are connected by a string over a pulley on an inclined plane.
Mass of both objects is 1 kg, incline angle is 37°, initial height of object A is 1 m, gravitational acceleration is 10 m/s², and there is no friction.
Component of gravity along the incline for object B is calculated as 6.018 N.
Force on object A is calculated as 10 N.
Net force causing acceleration of the system is calculated as 3.982 N.
Acceleration of the system is calculated as 1.991 m/s².
Time for object A to hit the ground is calculated as approximately 1.002 seconds.
Velocity of object B when the string breaks is calculated as approximately 1.995 m/s.
Acceleration of object B after the string breaks is calculated as -6.018 m/s².
Time for object B to reach maximum height is calculated as approximately 0.332 seconds.
Distance traveled up the incline before stopping is calculated as approximately 0.331 meters.
Time for object B to fall back down this distance is calculated as approximately 0.332 seconds.
Total time for object B to return to the bottom of the incline is calculated as approximately 0.664 seconds.
Final answer: The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is approximately 0.664 seconds.
